alert.note: Alert for Crowley; Kiowa (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 20 at 5:00PM MDT until July 20 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT FOR WEST CENTRAL KIOWA AND NORTHEASTERN CROWLEY COUNTIES... At 459 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles southwest of Wild Horse Point, or 35 miles north of La Junta, moving southeast at 30 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR northeastern Crowley County and northwestern Kiowa County. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Kiowa and northeastern Crowley Counties. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
